0201-d-03-16-01-TMBL.Narrative: THE 11:31PM CREW PULLED OUT OF TRACK 9 ON THE PORT LEAD, INTENDING TO SHOVE THROUGH TRACK 16 TO MITSUBISHI WITH 18 AUTO RACKS FOR SPOTTING WHILE THE 11:00 PM CREW PULLED OUT OF TRACK 8 TO THE WELCH LEAD WITH 10 CARS TO SWITCH ON THE LOWER SIDE OF YARD.  THE SWITCH OPERATOR ON THE 11:31 PM CREW, INTENDING TO LINE THE 9 SWITCH FOR SHOVE THROUGH TRACK 16, INSTEAD LINED THE BULL SWITCH IN ERROR.  THE11:31PM ENGINEER WAS THEN GIVEN A RADIO SIGNAL TO SHOVE THE TRAIN OF AUTO RACKS PROCEEDED DOWN THE WEST LEAD WHICH WAS OCCUPIED BY THE 11:00 PM CREW'S TRAIN.  THE 11:31 PM CREW'S EASTMOST AUTO RACK (ETTX 907547) STRUCK THE CAR 4TH FROM THE WEST END IN THE 11:00 PM CREW'S TRAIN (TTZX 862985) WHICH WAS A LOAD OF WALLBOARD FROM JAMES HARDIE (BUILDING PRODUCTS) DESTINED FOR THE BNSF.  THE 11:00 PM ENGINEER NOTICED THAT THE AUTO RACKS WERE GOING DOWN THE WRONG TRACK JUST PRIOR IMPACT AND IMMEDIATELYNOTIFIED HIS SWITCH SUPERVISOR WHO ATTEMPTED TO CONTACT THE 11:31 PM CREW BUT WAS UNABLE TO NOTIFY THEM BEFORE IMPACT OCCURRED.  THE 2 EAST AUTO RACKS IN THE 11:31 PM CREW'S (ETTX 907547 AND 802135) DERAILED. AS THE TIME OF IMPACT 11:31 PM SWITCH OPERATOR HAD JOINED SWITCH SUPERVISOR IN THE TRUCK TOPRECEDE MOVEMENT OF AUTO RACKS DOWN TRACK 16 VIA THE ACCESS ROAD BETWEEN TRACKS 17 AND 18.NoneNone

164517-d-03-06-01-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure engine(s) (railroad employee)

164517-d-03-06-01-SOO.Narrative: ENGINEER OF TRAIN 195-06 ASSISTING IN THE PROCESS OF SWAPPING POWER FOR TRAIN 571-06 AT ENDERLIN, NDSET UP THREE UNITS TO TRACK E1 WITH ONE HAND BRAKE APPLIED TO UNIT CP 5682.  ENGINEER OF TRAIN 195-06 WENT WEST OF MAIN LINE SWITCH AND WAS IN THE PROCESS OF TAKING OFF ANOTHER UNIT WHEN CONDUCTOR OFTRAIN 195-06  NOTED THAT THE THREE UNITS ON E1 ROLLING OUT EAST AND CALLED OUT TO THE CONDUCTOR OFTRAIN 571-06 WHO BOARDED THE ENGINES AND ATTEMPTED TO TIE ON THE HANDBRAKES ON UNIT FURX 3052 AND CP5739 TO STOP THE UNINTENDED MOVEMENT.  LOCOMOTIVES DID NOT SEEM TO SLOW DOWN SO THE CONDUCTOR OF TRAIN 571-06 DETRAINED FROM THE MOVING UNITS.   UNMANNED UNITS CONTINUED ROLLING FOR APPROXIMATELY 2000 FEET BEFORE STRIKING CARS ON E1 TRACK RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO THE UNITS AND CAR TLDX 120015 WHICH ALSO DERAILED DUE TO THE IMPACT.  NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED AS A RESULT OF THE INCIDENT AND NO TRACKDAMAGE WAS INCURRED.  ENGINEER OF TRAIN 195-O6 UHR TESTED.  ENGINEER ACCEPTED RESPONSIBILITY AND SIGNED WAIVER AND WAS ASSESSED FIVE-DAYS ACTUAL SUSPENSION FOR VIOLATION OF AIR BRAKE AND TRAIN HANDLING RULES.  WAIVER PROVISION ALSO INCLUDED THE REQUIREMENT OF ENGINEER TO HOLD FIVE SAFETY MEETINGS WITH CO-WORKERS WITHIN A TWO-WEEK PERIOD TO DISCUSS SERIOUSNESS OF THE INCIDENT AND TO EXPLAIN PROPERPROCEDURES.None

200103-d-03-05-01-ESHR.Primary Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
200103-d-03-05-01-ESHR.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
200103-d-03-05-01-ESHR.Narrative: ESHR1 WAS TRAVELING NORTH WITH A 3-MAN CREW AT 12 MPH WITH 38 CARS TO MAKE INTERCHANGE WITH NORFOLKSOUTHERN AT POCOMOKE, MD WHEN THE REAR SIX LOADS OF COAL DERAILED.  THE TRAIN CREW BROUGHT THE TRAINTO A STOP WITHIN 550 FEET FROM THE POINT OF DERAILMENT.  NO CARS TURNED OVER.  MOST OF THE EQUIPMENT DAMAGE IS THE COST OF CHANGING OUT WHEELS.  THERE WAS 533 FEET OF TRACK DAMAGE.  WE FOUND WIDE GAUGE OF 58"  AT POINT OF DERAILMENT WHICH WAS THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
